snippet: As insurers grow larger, the effect on consumers depends largely on how successfully other companies, particularly those created or attracted by the Affordable Care Act, can compete.
abstract: Question of whether mergers of largest health insurers in country will benefit consumers in form of lower prices and more choices will ultimately be answered by whether smaller, regional insurers can effectively compete with behemoths; consumer advocates have worried that consolidation will have limited positive effect; marketplaces created by Affordable Care Act could help smaller insurers compete with larger for-profit companies.
lead_paragraph: As insurers grow larger, the effect on consumers depends largely on how successfully other companies, particularly those created or attracted by the Affordable Care Act, can compete.

headline.main: With Merging of Insurers, Questions for Patients About Costs and Innovation
headline.print_headline: With Fusion of Insurers, Questions for Patients
